forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain after 11pm. Cloudy, with a low around 49. South wind 6 to 15 mph, with gusts as high as 23 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Sunday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Mostly cloudy, with a high near 60. South wind 13 to 16 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 90%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As the evening envelops Downtown San Francisco, an air of anticipation settles in. The clouds, thick and heavy, merge with the rising tendrils of rain that are set to make their appearance after eleven, painting the city in a muted palette of gray. The current temperature hovers around a cool 49, accompanied by a gentle yet steady wind from the south, whispering a promise of the rain soon to come. It is a night that may feel a touch damp, as those who venture out hear the distant echoes of raindrops pattering on rooftops, a comforting rhythm that speaks of renewal.

Tomorrow dawns with similar themes, a day wrapped in layers of clouds and rain. Expect the warmth to never quite touch the air, with highs lingering around 60, a perfect setting for a cozy café visit or an introspective stroll through the rain-slicked streets. Fog may still be playing hide-and-seek along the edges of the bay, giving the Golden Gate an ethereal quality as it emerges from the haze. Dressing in layers will be prudent; a light rain jacket or umbrella would not go amiss, offering a shield against the damp while allowing comfort in the chill. 

Given these conditions, consider an early venture to one of the local galleries or an engaging marketplace, where the ambiance remains vibrant, even in the chill. A leisurely afternoon spent with a cup of coffee and a good book might just be the kind of retreat that encapsulates the spirit of this weather—introspection wrapped in the soothing sound of rain.
